summary: The Student Empowerment Act (S. 152) amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow 529 education savings accounts to be used for kindergarten through 12th-grade educational expenses. These expenses include tuition, curriculum materials, books, online materials, tutoring, standardized tests, dual enrollment fees, and educational therapies for students with disabilities, regardless of whether the student attends public, private, religious school, or is homeschooled.
